title: batesresearch
author: batesresearch
content: Firstly we want to say a big thanks to Daniel / PolymerBit for these unbelieve notes and for taking the time to visit us! Stay tuned for some very exciting potential future developments! Daniel suggested we could look at either selling a few of the notes or auctioning them to raise some funds for the hub.We're posting here to showcase the notes and hope to update this page soon for any folk interested in getting a note! Take a look at these! We have notes ES003/ES004/ES005/ES006 available (We'll have a few one display at the hub aswell!)Lastly, imagine in the future we could do this ---> https://twitter.com/SatoshisPlaceUK/status/1578885029757087745 -   Stay tuned as physical bitcoin note IRL use is in discussion!

Not as in that movie.As I see here such a Polymerbit note costs 17.99 GBP if unfunded (i.e. as collectible). So if one also put 0.001 BTC onto it, it should worth twice as much, hence exchanging it like in that movie would be very bad business for the one holding the note.

comments.author: polymerbit
comments.body: One important thing I forgot to mention. The reason why the serial number starts with ES is because it stands for "exposed sample". The black square with IIIS is typically added into the note, which in this case makes it "exposed" to show how the private key is protected. This is also why you can see that it's overlayed on the design.Essentially, these are prototypes that were given to Batesresearch with full permission to either auction, hold on to or destroy. All the proceeds from the ones gifted will remain with him, and I'm glad that we can all support his great cause.
